doc.previous: She made a series of speeches in the Lords criticising the Maastricht Treaty,[206] describing it as "a treaty too far" and stated "I could never have signed this treaty".[214] She cited A. V. Dicey when stating that as all three main parties were in favour of the treaty, the people should have their say in a referendum.[215]
doc.after: Thatcher was honorary Chancellor of the College of William and Mary in Virginia (1993â2000)[216] and also of the University of Buckingham (1992â1999), the UK's first private university, which she had opened in 1975.[217]
